casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Appellee, v. Earl William BATTEN, Appellant. No. 12469. United States Court of Appeals Fourth Circuit. Argued Oct. 28, 1968. Decided Oct. 31, 1968. Edward Delk, Norfolk, Va. (court-appointed counsel), for appellant. Roger T. Williams, Asst. U. S. Atty. (C. V. Spratley, Jr., U. S. Atty., on brief), for appellee.

*478Before BOREMAN and BUTZNER, Circuit Judges, and MERHIGE, District Judge.

PER CURIAM:

Having been convicted of bank robbery-in violation of 18 U.S.C. § 2113(a), Earl William Batten appeals. Upon consideration of the briefs and oral argument, we find no error. The conviction is affirmed.
